availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John McClaren (Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, attorney and commissioner of deeds)

body.p: Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, attorney and commissioner of deeds. Pennsylvania native. Son of William McClaren and Elisa McClaren. Attorney in Pittsburgh in 1860 and 1865. Commissioner of deeds for the Commonwealth of Kentucky in Pennsylvania in 1865.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Pennsylvania, Allegheny County, Pittsburgh, Ward 3, p. 177; Directory of Pittsburgh and Allegheny Cities, the Adjoining Boroughs and Villages, also, Parts of the Adjacent Townships, for 1865-'66, George H. Thurston, comp. (Pittsburgh: George H. Thurston, 1865), p. 386; KYR-0001-007-0394.
